26599.name: Scrim That
26599.description:
Quickly add a scrim over a selected layer with Scrim That.


Want to create a scrim over your design to overlay a dialog box? But hate having to resize the scrim to match the width, height and correct layer position?


Scrim That has you covered with one-click magic scrimming.


Usage

Select a frame, group or shape layer and run the plugin to create the scrim over it. Tweak the opacity of the layer to your desired value.


Open Source

Scrim That is open source, and contributions are most welcome.

27912.name: Generator
27912.description:
This is a node-based generative design plugin for Figma. It is in early development and free for now, but after reaching a certain stage it will go on subscription to support further work.


Discord for feedback


—————————————————————————————————————————————


Changing decimal places is done by typing in a value with those decimal places, so typing in "0.000" will set it to three.


Some sliders have a display min/max and an actual min/max. The display values are typical/recommended, the actual values let you to do whatever you want. Hold Cmd/Ctrl to scroll past the display limits.


Cmd/Ctrl+D duplicates the selection.


Holding Shift while pasting or duplicating, so Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+V or Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+D, will paste/duplicate the selection with incoming connections duplicated as well.


Hold Alt and mouse over a node to highlight only it and its connections. This helps navigate complex graphs.


Hold Cmd/Ctrl while selecting a node to also select everything downstream from it. Hold Cmd/Ctrl+Shift to select the entire tree the node is in.


Colors outside the sRGB gamut are crossed out with diagonal lines.


All wires can be hidden by toggling the button in the top-right corner. This way you can work with your data as a flow, but see it as data.
27912.release_notes:
* added value adjustment with arrow keys
* made calculated values bold italic
* improved node selection
* fixed UI issues

27327.name: SimpleStage
27327.description:
Improve your client communication and speed up your website design process! SimpleStage gives you a single platform to collect content, design feedback, and website feedback.


Sync your files directly from Figma to SimpleStage and send them to your client or copywriters to provide content or leave design feedback.


Gather content from clients and stakeholders during the design process


Collecting content is one of the most difficult aspects of a creative project, but SimpleStage makes the process easier with content collection fields and automated client reminders.


  • Visual content entry
  • Customizable fields
  • Easily collaborate
  • Version history


Collect design feedback and collaborate quickly with clients


Sharing designs and collecting feedback from your clients is easy and fast with SimpleStage. Clients can comment and annotate on your uploaded design to give feedback directly on elements.


  • Speed up design review
  • Annotate designs
  • Communicate faster
  • Version history

19593.name: StuDocreator
19593.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

27831.name: IntelligenceBank Assets
27831.description: The IntelligenceBank Assets plugin for Figma makes it easy for designers to browse, search and insert their approved IntelligenceBank image and brand assets.

25258.name: Bitmap Tool
25258.description:
一些实用的位图功能


#### 位图等比缩放

快速将位图缩放至1倍、2倍等整数倍；


#### 精灵图裁剪

将 sheetpng 按行列裁剪成宽高相等的序列帧图片；


#### 切片转png

将带有导出选项的切片/形状等转成png，并自动添加到舞台上；



#### 选中切片生成gif

选中 切片/frame 等对象后快速生成gif；

图层名后加“#500ms”字样可以自定单帧的延迟；

gif序列帧先后顺序按图层层级排列；



#### 导入lottie序列帧

导入lottie动画到舞台，特别适合导入矢量动画到舞台；


#### 组件转画框

快速将 compent 转成frame
25258.release_notes: gif序列帧的前后顺序按图层层级前后处理

26535.name: DAI - Documentação de Acessibilidade para Interfaces
26535.description:
O DAI é um plugin para o Figma projetado para documentar os requisitos de acessibilidade de interface para a WEB dentro do protótipo.


O DAI é um produto de um Trabalho de Conclusão de Curso (TCC) do curso de Design Digital na Universidade Federal do Ceará Campus em Quixadá. O trabalho foi construído pelo aluno George Moreno de Oliveira orientado pela professora doutora Ingrid Teixeira Monteiro, professora da UFC e pesquisadora na área da Interação Humano-computador.


O trabalho intitulado "Desenvolvimento de um plugin para documentação de acessibilidade para interfaces no Figma" está atualmente na fase de desenvolvimento do produto, o plugin, que pode ser utilizado clonando o seguinte repositório.

27923.name: Semantic Versioning
27923.description:
Simplified Semantic Versioning for your Figma Nodes without external dependencies and consumable via API.


Features:

  • Guided Semantic Versioning for your Nodes.
  • Issue Figma Document-Versions alongside the node versions.
  • History (and undo) the versioning.
  • Commit Messages
  • Consumable version information via Figma REST-API


This plugin intents to help you keeping track of changes to your design by simply attaching a version number to your nodes.


The version number might be used to indicate the expected backend work triggered by the current design changes.


And it also allows you to reference the version in other tools and assets like issue trackers and documentation.


This plugin has no external dependencies, the version information is saved in the current document.


Be aware the meaning of the word "backend" depends highly on your project setup. In a progressive web app the "backend" is usually a front-end implementation whereas backend in a classical server-based webpage will be the actual server-side webapp implementation.


How to use this Plugin?

Select one or more nodes and run the plugin.


How to use the Version Workflow?

The version number consist of three to four numerical parts:


MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH(-rfc.RFC)


The Rfc-part in brackets is optional and depends on the "requests for comments" setting.

The numbers are supposed to increment only.


MAJOR

The MAJOR-release number increase marks a backward-incompatible change of your design.


Imagine you changed a frame containing a form by removing an input. As you might assume this will break the current implementation of the app using this design because the app actually works with that input and might expect a value attached to it.


Propagating this change will likely break the backend-implementation. You communicate this by increasing the major release number by one actually saying this is a backward-incompatible change. And you expect it to break the current implementation.


MINOR

The MINOR-release number increase marks a backward-compatible change of your design, usually by adding a feature.


Imagine you extended the functionality of a frame by changing the design to display an additional input element. While this will require backend work to make the input actually work, rolling out the design won't break the application. So that is a backward compatible change of the current design.


Increasing the MINOR release version communicates you added a change which might require backend work but won't break the current backend implementation.


PATCH

The PATCH-release number increase marks a simple fix of your design which does not require any backend work.


Let's say you adjust some colors or got a ticket telling you a responsiveness feature isn't working as expected. By fixing this you correct the intentional implementation of the current design.


By using the PATCH version number you communicate there is no change in the backend-interface of your design and it won't require any backend changes.


RFC

Depending on your surrounding development process you might not be able to decide on your own when a design is ready to release. In this case you may enable the "request for comments"-based workflow.


The Rfc-workflow adds a -rfc.1-label to the version reflecting the current iteration in your approval process.


Let's say you make a first draft of a form, since it's a minor change, you choose to add a minor-change and because you have the rfc-workflow enabled you're only minor release option (given your current version is 1.0.0) is 1.1.0-rfc.1. This communicates you drafted a first version of the intended minor change.

Your team then discusses your draft and gives you some feedback which requires changes. After these changes you increase the Rfc number resulting in 1.1.0-rfc.2. After another discussion with your team all are fine with the changes and you release the design to 1.1.0.


How to use the Settings?

The settings are saved per document. That said you will have to adjust the settings once per document.


Use "request for comments"

Checking this option enables a "pre-release" path for your versioning which adds the -rfc.<<number>> counter to the version.


Using this feature allows you to mark your changes as a "proposal" depending on the workflow your design work is embedded in.


Unchecking this option changes only the available options for you next version change and does not automatically change any saved versions in the document.


Use commit messages

Checking this option shows a text field to take a optional commit message. The draft of a commit message is internally saved in the node. The commit message is saved in a small history (currently up to 5 elements) being consumabe via the Figma API.


Use version appendix at Node names

Checking this option enables @-prefixed version appendices for node names. When you save a version on a node, an @-symbol will be added to node name (if it not already exists) and the saved version is appended to the name.


This feature also adds two more version options "From Appendix" and "To Appendix" to the user interface (if the version appendix and the internal version of that node differ) allowing you to f.e. manually set or remove the version. Please keep in mind that 0.x versions are not supported by this plugin.


Unchecking this option does currently not remove any version appendices. If you want to remove any version appendices from your nodes you will have to do this manually at the moment.


Issue the save of a new Figma file version..

With this option enabled, the plugin will submit any version change (may it be Initial, Major, Minor, Patch, Rfc or Release) to the Figma version history (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360038006754-View-a-file-s-version-history).


The version title will be "Nodename@Version" and the description will be the commit message if enabled and provided.



API

Purpose of this interface is to provide external access to the stored version number and the retained commit history per node.


Please consult the repository for more information: https://github.com/florianb/figma-semantic-versioning#api
27923.release_notes:
- Major ui changes to allow the change of selection while the plugin is opened.
- Add support for save of "Figma document version" on version change.
- Add support for plugin-internal version history enabling a "revert".
- Add support for commit messages.

27604.name: Auto Layout via keyboard
27604.description:
I am just too lazy to click on the small button of Auto Layout to change the value, so I made this plugin.


if you find this helpful, feel free to try it out.

parameters.name: Align direction
parameters.description: Choose to align vertical or horizontal.

parameters.name: Item Spacing
parameters.description: Enter the value of item spacing

27502.name: Framely – todos for frames
27502.description:
Select a frame and add a todo to it!


Contact me in telegram for support: kopyl

27597.name: SCSS Sprites
27597.description: Generates SCSS code from the layers on a frame to create a CSS sprite with 2x pixel density screen support
27597.release_notes: Adds basic statistics for generated scss code.

27467.name: Resize from
27467.description:
Resize from is inspired by a feature of other design tools that lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left) simply by typing a dimension followed by the letter: c(enter), l(eft), r(ight), t(op) or b(ottom).


Plans for next steps…

  • Keyboard nudge amounts, proportional resizing, more…

27764.name: Style Swap
27764.description:
Ever needed to quickly swap all appearances of a specific style to another one?


Style Swap scans your document for styles used in any layer, then you'd choose what style you want swapped and choose a style you want to swap to.


This is a parameters-only plugin, you can run it by tabbing into it.


Note: This currently only works on typography styles.

27617.name: Cercle
27617.description:
Open source your designs on cercle.design, and let others contribute to them.


Note: this project is still in beta, please report any bugs to richardmguerre@gmail.com.

27748.name: figeleton
27748.description:
figeleton


Generate Skeleton Component from Figma. Use Figma as a source.


Skeleton components generated by this plugin follow the specifications of @figeleton/skeleton.


Options

  • animation: Value of Skeleton animation prop. Preview of the option can be found here
  • Square as: whether to generate a square node on Figma as a circular skeleton or as it(square) is.


Plan

  • Currently, only React is supported, but plan to support HTML soon.
  • Preview Generated Skeleton
